issue.title: Support resize increments

labels.name: D - easy
labels.description: Likely easier than most tasks here

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
Basically this means restricting window size to multiples of some defined size. [X11](https://tronche.com/gui/x/xlib/ICC/client-to-window-manager/wm-normal-hints.html) and [OS X](https://developer.apple.com/reference/appkit/nswindow/1419390-resizeincrements) provide this feature. Windows doesn't seem to have support for this but it could be emulated with additional code. Not sure about Wayland.

This feature is probably only useful for terminal emulators like [Alacritty](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/388). So is it worth to be added to the library?

issue.title: Exact fit snap window resize
issue.body: The Alacritty window should "snap-to-grid" so that the window is always exactly big enough to fit a grid of characters. This functionality is available in iTerm2 and Terminal on macOS (and probably others).

issue.title: Feature request - resize alacritty by column and line
issue.body:
I am using tmux, emacs and other stuff in terminal. They have modelines in the bottom. Every time I have to resize alacritty to a proper size (just include n columns and m line) to eliminate the wasted space around modeline.

tmux with ugly wasted space around modeline
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49093544/103655310-03ae8f80-4fa2-11eb-8cb1-6a1b2f9a5906.png)

tmux where the modeline is perfectly aligned with the border of alacritty.
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49093544/103655416-2ccf2000-4fa2-11eb-921d-60a762298b15.png)

Although I can set
```
window:
   dimensions:
    columns: 80
    lines: 30
```
to make alacritty fit tmux at first. However, once I resize it, it will be hard for me to find a proper size, under which all the stuff is aligned. I wonder if an option can be added to make it possible to resize the alacritty by column and line. An example is made as below:

![Peek 2021-01-05 22-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49093544/103655875-dadaca00-4fa2-11eb-8202-afc08ceff13c.gif)

issue.title: option to resize windows not smoothly but snapping to lines and chars?
issue.body:
the problem currently is that when you resize the window, it resizes smoothly, which means that the padding on the bottom and right sides are larger (because they are at half a char/line). is there some option or some plan to add this feature?

Thanks!

issue.title: Add an option to ask X11/MacOS to use window resize increments (cell-precision resize)
issue.body:
Hello
This is a feature that I really miss, and I knew about X11 EWMHs, so I've decided to implement it.

Tested it on AwesomeWM (which does support (re)size hints) and on macOS Big Sur - where I had the issue with logical pixels, but if you double the increment it works fine, although obviously it snaps by two cells at a time.

I am open to review comments on this, I am not sure I got the #[cfg]s right or about should the macOS part even be included and so on, and I am willing for this feature to finally be part of the program

Partially closes #388 and #1702, Windows has none of that, to my knowledge

issue.title: Feature Request: use font size as the smallest unit for resizing windows
issue.body: If already exist an issue, feel free to close this. (I searched the issue list, and not found) Other terminal app resize window use font size as the smallest unit, like iterm2, wezterm(https://github.com/wez/wezterm/search?q=use_resize_increments&type=code). For alacritty, I can't find such option control this. Use pixel as resize unit is flexible, but in sometimes, use font size will make ui looks consistent. the left one is alacritty, and the right one is iterm2 ### System OS: macOS Version: alacritty 0.10.1 (2844606)

issue.title: Have Action to scale Font+Win dimension at the same time
issue.body:
Coming from MacOS' Terminal App, I grew fond of using Cmd +/- to scale both the font size and the window dimension at the same time, while the ratio is being kept. Kind of like zooming the full window. Alacritty doesn't seem to have this Action implemented. It's rather trivial apparently (kudos for writing approachable software!) I have this implemented in a fork, atm. If this feature is desired, I'd spend time polishing it and open a PR.

If not, that's great too.

issue.title: Resize the window by cell dimensions
issue.body:
This should resize window by cell dimensions granularity instead of using pixels.

Fixes #388.

--

Probably will need a config option for that, idk, given that it might not be desirable behavior for everyone.

It works fine on both macOS/GNOME.
